Whenever I work on something new or need to understand something better, I read a book on the subject.

  • Make Time *

    Jake Knapp and John Zeratsky • Read in Feb 2020

    Full of simple tips that can help you get more from your day by killing distractions to improve focus. Very easy to read.

  • Articulating Design Decisions *

    Tom Greever • Read in Mar 2020

    Essential read if you doing hands-on design work and have to convince stakeholders about your design choices. This book will help you expertly explain your design decisions.

  • User Story Mapping *

    Jeff Patton and Peter Economy • Read in Jan 2020

    Must read for every product designer serious about building the right product in a right way. Wish I had read it years ago, but better late than never.

  • Art Direction for the Web *

    Andy Clarke • Read in Dec 2019

    Websites mostly look all the same these days. Andy clearly explains “Art Direction” and how it can help you design memorable websites. He’s also one of my favorite designers since I started in 2007.

  • Designing Brand Identity *

    Alina Wheeler • Read in Nov 2018

    Read this one while revising Unmetric’s brand identity. As a T-shaped designer, I must say, without this book I’d be lost in figuring out the branding process and deliverables.
